DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To determine effectiveness physical therapy axillary web syndrome improve pain , reduce swell increase mobility shoulder . Design : randomize single-blinded controlled trial . Follow-up : five physical therapy assessment : pre-intervention ; post-intervention , 3 month post-intervention , 6 month post-intervention . Participants : Eighty consecutive woman diagnose axillary web syndrome undergoing unilateral breast cancer surgery ALND SLND Prıíncipe de Asturias Hospital Alcalà de Henares , Madrid ( Spain ) . Randomization : woman randomly assign two group EpiData 3.1 software . Interventions : Physical Therapy group : Physical Therapy compose manual lymph-drainage technique axilla , proximal ipsilateral arm , specific thumb manual lymph-drainage taut cord make gradually flexible , conjunction progressive active action-assisted arm exercise ; Control group : progressive active action-assisted arm exercise . 9 physical therapy session .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Physical Therapy Axillary Web Syndrome After Breast Cancer Surgery
DOC.criteria: Unilateral breast cancer ; Breast surgery lymphadenectomy / sentinel lymph node biopsy ; Axillary web syndrome chest / upper limb operate side ; Consent participate study ; No contraindication physical therapy ( infection , metastasis ) ; Cognitive impairment ; Visual impairment reading ; Lymphedema ; Bilateral breast cancer ; Systemic disease ( metastasis ) , Infection ; Locoregional recurrence .
